title: ‘I lost £940 of my student loan to fraudsters pretending to be my bank’
text:
Has a company treated you unfairly? Our consumer champion, Katie Morley, is here to help. For how to contact her click here.

Dear Katie,

I am a university student who has recently been conned out of my student loan via a sophisticated banking fraud.

I received a call purportedly from my bank, Metro Bank, flagging a suspicious payment to a car company. I asked for it to be cancelled but was told that as my information had been compromised I would need to move the money into an internal Metro Bank account.

It would also cancel my cards and send me new ones in the post, I was told. It sent me a series of confirmation texts and the money was moved.

On suspecting things might not be quite right,...
